summary: This bill, the Global Criminal Justice Act, establishes an Office of Global Criminal Justice within the Department of State. The office, led by an Ambassador-at-Large, will advise the Secretary of State on issues related to atrocities, formulate US policy on prevention and accountability, coordinate with international bodies, assist in fact-finding missions, and utilize various tools to address atrocities. It also aims to promote the rule of law and serve as a point of contact for international tribunals.
